content.description:
Buffer solutions containing <math alttext="N a 2 C O 3" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a H C O 3" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaHC</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> range in <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from 10.0 to 11.0. The chemical equation below represents the equilibrium between <math alttext="C O 3 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the table lists the composition of four different buffer solutions at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="C O 3 with a negative 2 charge aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium H C O 3 with a negative 1 charge aqueous plus O H negative 1 charge aqueous. K sub b equals 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power at 25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>at</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Buffer
 <math alttext="the molar concentration of N a H C O 3" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NaHCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.question: Which of the following mathematical expressions can be used to determine the approximate <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of buffer 1 ?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H equals the negative log of 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power, plus the log of the fraction 0.100 over 0.150, equals 3.50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals the negative log of 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power, plus the log of the fraction 0.150 over 0.100, equals 3.85" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3.85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals, open bracket, 14.00 plus the log of 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power, close bracket, plus the log of the fraction 0.100 over 0.150, equals 10.15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mn>14.00</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)]</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10.15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals, open bracket, 14.00 plus the log of 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power, close bracket, plus the log of the fraction 0.150 over 0.100, equals 10.50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mn>14.00</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)]</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p H equals, open bracket, 14.00 plus the log of 2.1 times 10 to the negative 4 power, close bracket, plus the log of the fraction 0.100 over 0.150, equals 10.15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mn>14.00</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)]</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10.15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
